title: Translation and text length
content:
We are currently in the early stages of designing a book to printed in both English and German editions. Does anyone know a good rule af thumb for how much the text length will increase once the translation into German occurs?   
   
A colleague of mine remembers an increase of around 30% in overall length. Can anyone confirm this figure or offer a more educated answer?   
   
Thanks in advance...
author: studioblue

comments.content:
I don't know about German, but my experience with English - French is that it varies according to the translator, and to which language you start with.   
   
So I would ask the editor or the translator, and put them on the spot!
